summary: G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from the SCA, indicating Blakey's employment. These documents list Blakey's name, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA during 1978. Specifically, the documents cover the periods of April, August, and December of 1978. The consistent appearance of Blakey's name across these payroll certifications suggests continuous employment with the committee during this period.
significance: The documents indicate that G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations, which investigated the JFK assassination. The specific role and contributions of Blakey within the committee are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests involvement in the committee's work.
